RV Registered Name:
Name: Hotel Indigo Auckland/ 51 Albert
For Blog?: Yes
Project Status: Under Construction
Completion Date: 2021 Q2
Detailed completion:
Sector: Accommodation - Hotel/ Residential - Apartments
KML: Colouring: measle_grey
Street Address: 51-53 Albert St
Suburb: Auckland Central
City: Auckland
Homes: 24
Accommodation Units: 225
Retail Space (sqm):
Office Space (sqm): 0
Industrial Space (sqm): 0
Carparks:
Developer: Ninety Four Feet
Architect: Scott Carver
Builder:
Current Owner: n/a
Data sources: https://www.oneroof.co.nz/news/homes-that-come-with-a-full-hotel-service-36226
Other notes: Resource consent granted in March 2009 for 150 apartments (valid until Feb 2022). Includes air rights above 55 Albert. Was initially marketed as "Saffron apartments" by Sanctuary Developments. The site sold mid-2013 to KNC Construction, who put it up for sale in mid-2015 and again in Apr 2016. It has now sold to Ninety Four Feet, an Australian developer. The current plan is for a Hotel Indigo (part of InterContinental Hotels Group). A new resource consent was granted in June 2018. Demolition began in April 2019
Website: https://www.51albert.com/

Other notes: 230 apartments in three buildings (150 to be sold and 80 to be leased long term). Civil works began in 2018, but a start on building construction has been delayed due to costs - they're now expecting to start on the first building in Apr 2019
Website: https://www.toruapartments.co.nz/

Data sources: https://www.propbd.co.nz/residents-move-into-201-unit-rose-garden-at-albany/ and https://www.nzherald.co.nz/business/news/article.cfm?c_id=3&objectid=12045060
Other notes: Stage 1 of a larger project which will have a total of 832 apartments. Resource consent was granted Dec 2014, and the stage 1 apartments settled in July 2018. Stage 2 could apparently start construction in 2019.
Website: http://nzrosegarden.co.nz/

For the time being, there are southbound bus shoulder lanes between Greville Rd and Constellation Drive, used during peak times.

Other notes: Originally, construction was expected to begin by the end of 2017 for a 2019 finish. Construction is starting on Aug 1 2019., construction is not far off starting, and opening is likely to be late 2020 or early 2021

Stage 1, with 31 apartments, was completed in Jan 2018. Stage 2 is under construction is underway and due for completion in August 2019. Stage 3 will finish circa 2021.

Industrial Space (sqm): 0
Carparks:
Developer: Government
Architect: Weir Walker Architects
Builder:
Current Owner:
Data sources: http://www.quakeaccommodation.govt.nz/about-portable-dwellings
Other notes: One of three "temporary accommodation villages... set up by the Government to help meet increasing demand for short term rental housing after the Canterbury earthquakes". This is the only one of the three to be built as permanent housing, which will be sold on the open market "once demand for temporary accommodation in Canterbury has reduced".
